New Records: Manny Machado tied the Padres' record for career homers with 163 home runs, tying Nate Colbert's 50-year old record.
Key Match Events: Manny Machado hit two home runs, including a 375-foot shot into the seats in left field.
Michael Conforto led off the sixth with his 16th homer into the seats in right field.
A big defensive gaffe by the Giants allowed the Padres to score three runs in the first inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Padres gained ground in the National League playoff race, going up by 1 1/2 games over Arizona for the top wild-card spot.
The Padres also drew within four games of first-place Los Angeles in the NL West.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres won for the fourth time in five games and the Giants lost for the fifth time in six games.
The upcoming San Francisco Giants Schedule includes games against the Milwaukee Brewers, San Diego Padres, Baltimore Orioles, and Kansas City Royals.
